iati-activity.title: Scotland-Malawi Mental Health Education Project (SMMHEP):Building Mental Health Education
iati-activity.description: There is currently one psychiatrist for all of Malawi. This project aims to improve the treatment of mental illness through the education and training of mental healthcare professionals, with a particular focus on improving the identification and treatment of maternal depression. It includes four key areas of activity including: supporting psychiatrists from Scotland to deliver undergraduate training at the College of Medicine; the establishment of a Masters postgraduate training course, as well as planning training in mental health specialties; producing a "Malawi Mental Health Handbook" which will form the basis of standardised undergraduate nurse and clinical officer training; establishing an educational resource centre, and an annual conference to share best practice and research in mental health. In the long term, it is intended that the project becomes self-sustaining through the development of local capacity, enabling the psychiatrists trained in Malawi to own and deliver mental health training. In 2005, the Scottish Government (in 2005) supported 25 psychiatrists from Scotland to teach psychiatric skills to medical students in Malawi.
